channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
Today in revolutionarily good wonky governance. https://t.co/lJpJpohion

Dark Brandon unleashes the forces of Enlightenment from the chains of Monopoly Capitalism!

item.description: Dark Brandon strikes again! https://t.co/lJpJpo0fmn
item.source:markdown: Dark Brandon strikes again! https://t.co/lJpJpo0fmn

item.description:
@trekonomics Same approach as SpaceX — finding failure points in existing governance.

@trekonomics SpaceX profited off the engineering disfunction created by the too-tight nexus between Congress and government contractors.

@trekonomics Here he’s profiting from the disfunction caused by local officials elected to posts giving them spending authority way beyond their ability to understand and manage.

@trekonomics Amplified by 40 years of Reaganaut anti-bureaucrat propaganda.

@trekonomics Avignon has nearly twice the population of Kyle, Texas. Does its mayor have similar power to sign contracts with itinerant transportation grifters?

@trekonomics Much more ambitious and meta than Bezos.
@ZacharyBraiterm @Joyce_Karam And not a violation of the principles of the JCPOA.
item.source:markdown: @ZacharyBraiterm @Joyce_Karam And not a violation of the principles of the JCPOA.

item.description:
@joshtpm Speaking of Dems in disarray: https://t.co/EqhyBjCr6W

@joshtpm I don’t normally read the Federalist, but I got an email from a guy in Florida who knows a thing or two about federal investigations bringing it to my attention.

item.description:
@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute “Uh, Lorraine, do you mean the Jewish new year?”

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute “Yes, Rosh Hashanah”

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute “Lorraine, Rosh Hashanah is celebrated privately, in homes and synagogues, not in Times Square.”

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute “Oh. Back to you.”
@ZacharyBraiterm What do you mean “stand by”?
item.source:markdown: @ZacharyBraiterm What do you mean “stand by”?

item.description:
@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute Probably yes, since that aired no later than fall 1980.

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute Do you know the sketch of which I speak?

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute I think it featured Lorraine Newman reporting from Times Square where “at midnight, the ball will drop, ushering in the new year, and God will open the Book of Life, deciding who will live and who will die.”

@ZacharyBraiterm Show me a piece where someone says, we’d prefer the US keep the present unilateral sanctions even if Iran starts building a couple nukes a year, and no, we don’t want US troops to die stopping the Iranian bomb program.
item.source:markdown: @ZacharyBraiterm Show me a piece where someone says, we’d prefer the US keep the present unilateral sanctions even if Iran starts building a couple nukes a year, and no, we don’t want US troops to die stopping the Iranian bomb program.

item.description:

@eddyportnoy @AlanZweibel @yivoinstitute Was he responsible for the Weekend Update Times Square Rosh Hashanah ball-drop report?

item.description:

item.description: @ZacharyBraiterm The longterm argument, going back at least to Rabin, was that Israel needed to join the Sunni alliance to prevent the Iranian bomb. The bomb is what Bibi has his friends at Warner Bros illustrate for his UN talk.
item.source:markdown: @ZacharyBraiterm The longterm argument, going back at least to Rabin, was that Israel needed to join the Sunni alliance to prevent the Iranian bomb. The bomb is what Bibi has his friends at Warner Bros illustrate for his UN talk.
